tweets.text: @camdez @localrapfan I am convinced people ignore developer experience because they think their work *should be hard* and the increased number of incantations increases value– which is the diametric opposite of my values of speed and simplicity

@camdez @localrapfan I am mostly being hyperbolic, but the thing that annoys me is the same phenomena as the React-ification of everyday apps and personal projects. So many people applying tools meant for billion dollar hundred-engineer projects to their first to do list app because it is “better”
@chris_honeybee Does putting on a leather apron help at all? Seems to work for other industries

@SoC_trilogy @repligate Hey Matthew, have been following along as you do these explorations- I would love to do a recorded chat about these discoveries and your approach if you are interested. DM or email me at ejfox@ejfox.com
https://t.co/Gq5r0IgmU9
@benjamindurland you want this for your site? Would make things easy

@JasonAbbruzzese @auren Its a skill I regret spending years cultivating, it is not transferrable in any way, I don’t really see it as a valuable skill  – why are we telling young people learning to navigate corporate structures is valuable?
@auren @JasonAbbruzzese Why is it a valuable skill?

Okay, got a folder of .jpgs generating json which is then turned into a webpage by vue/nuxt – now if I want to publish a new photo blog post I can add captions in lightroom, export the folder, run this, and press publish (which I think is pretty cool) https://t.co/BSZ4521sS4
